articles.description: Making his first intervention in the Epstein scandal, the King said he is ready to support the police in their inquiries.

articles.description: The health secretary says he is publishing the messages "after a weekend of smear and innuendo that I have something to hide".
articles.title: Wes Streeting publishes messages with Peter Mandelson, revealing election fears and criticism of government

articles.description: Ghislaine Maxwell, the jailed associate of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, invoked her Fifth Amendment right to avoid self-incrimination.
articles.title: Ghislaine Maxwell refuses to answer questions about Epstein from Congress

articles.description: The video appeal comes as a deadline looms to pay the people believed to be holding the TV hosts's mum.
articles.title: Savannah Guthrie pleads for public's help finding missing mother

articles.description: The Scottish Labour leader says No 10 has "not been good enough" but Sir Keir insists he will not resign.
articles.title: Cabinet ministers rally round PM as Anas Sarwar calls for him to quit

articles.description: The call for Sir Keir Starmer to resign is a defining moment in Sarwar's leadership of Scottish Labour.
articles.title: Anas Sarwar makes his biggest political gamble - but can it pay off?

articles.description: It comes days after the Local Government Association warned that eight in 10 English councils would face bankruptcy, if they had to honour deficits.
articles.title: £5bn council SEND debts to be paid off by government

articles.title: Machine guns to machetes: Weapons that massacred thousands in Iran

articles.title: Violinist Ben Gunnery sent hundreds of nude images to women

articles.description: Residents on the remote British overseas territory have been left stranded after fire safety concerns grounded flights.
articles.title: St Helena: Only airport on remote British overseas island closed over safety fears
